question: Pseudopterigium is not seen in?
exp: ANSWER: (D) Astigmatism. REF: Smolin and Thoft s The Cornea: Scientific Foundations and Clinical Practice 4th ed page 1005A pseudopterygium is a fibrovascular ring that arises in bulbar conjunctiva and goes on the cornea involving a chemotic conjuctival fold. Etiology: inflammatory conditions like. Chemical burns. Trauma epithelial defects (Eye surgery, Injury). Cicatricial conjunctivitis. Peripheral comeal ulceration. Hard contact lens Pterygium. Pseudopterygium. Etiology. Degenerative condition. Inflammatory condition. Site. Seen usually on nasal or temporal side. Can occur any where in conjunctiva. Age> 40 years. Any age. Status. Stationary to progressive. Stationary. Probe test. Glass rod or probe cant be passed underneath. Can be passed
